filmography.title: He Who Gets Slapped
filmography.role_description: A bareback rider in a circus who is loved by a clown (Lon Chaney) but betrothed to a wealthy baron.
filmography.plot: A disgraced scientist becomes a circus clown and falls in love with a beautiful bareback rider, trying to save her from a loveless marriage.
filmography.awards: First Film Produced Entirely by MGM

filmography.title: Lady of the Night
filmography.role_description: A dual role playing two women from opposite sides of the tracks who vie for the love of the same man.
filmography.plot: A judge's daughter and a girl from the reform school look exactly alike and fall in love with the same inventor.

filmography.title: Upstage
filmography.role_description: A stenographer who dreams of becoming a star and faces the harsh realities of show business.
filmography.plot: A girl tries to make it in vaudeville but learns that talent and hard work are more important than ego.

filmography.title: The Student Prince in Old Heidelberg
filmography.role_description: A barmaid in Heidelberg who falls deeply in love with a prince, leading to a heartbreaking romance.
filmography.plot: A prince enjoys the freedom of student life and falls in love with a barmaid, but duty calls him back to the throne.

filmography.title: The Actress
filmography.role_description: A popular stage actress who marries a nobleman but finds aristocratic life stifling.
filmography.plot: An actress leaves the stage to marry into high society but struggles to fit in with her husband's stuffy family.

filmography.title: A Lady of Chance
filmography.role_description: A captivating con artist who targets wealthy men but finds herself falling for one of her marks.
filmography.plot: A grifter tries to swindle a naive Southerner but ends up falling in love with him.

filmography.title: The Trial of Mary Dugan
filmography.role_description: A showgirl accused of murdering her wealthy lover who must defend her reputation in court.
filmography.plot: A stenographer is put on trial for the murder of her lover, and her defense attorney brother tries to prove her innocence.

filmography.title: The Last of Mrs. Cheyney
filmography.role_description: A sophisticated jewel thief who poses as a wealthy Australian widow to infiltrate British high society.
filmography.plot: A woman poses as a society lady to steal a pearl necklace but is caught by a Lord who falls in love with her.

filmography.title: Their Own Desire
filmography.role_description: A young woman devastated by her father's infidelity who unwittingly falls in love with the son of his mistress.
filmography.plot: A girl is disgusted by her father's affair, only to fall in love with a man who turns out to be the other woman's son.

filmography.title: The Divorcee
filmography.role_description: A sophisticated wife who decides to match her husband's infidelity with her own, challenging the double standards of the era.
filmography.plot: After discovering her husband has been unfaithful, a woman decides to balance the scales by having an affair of her own.

filmography.title: Let Us Be Gay
filmography.role_description: A plain housewife who transforms into a glamorous woman to win back her straying husband.
filmography.plot: A woman divorces her cheating husband and reinvents herself, meeting him again years later in Paris.

filmography.title: Strangers May Kiss
filmography.role_description: A modern woman who pursues a globe-trotting journalist, refusing to settle for a conventional marriage.
filmography.plot: A woman follows her lover to Mexico and Europe, determined to live life on her own terms.

filmography.title: A Free Soul
filmography.role_description: The free-spirited daughter of an alcoholic lawyer who begins a dangerous affair with a ruthless gangster.
filmography.plot: A defense attorney's daughter falls for the gangster her father got acquitted, leading to tragedy.

filmography.title: Private Lives
filmography.role_description: A divorced woman who finds herself honeymooning with her new husband in the room next to her ex-husband.
filmography.plot: A divorced couple meet again while honeymooning with their new spouses and realize they are still in love.

filmography.title: Strange Interlude
filmography.role_description: A woman whose life is defined by her neurotic relationships with her father, husband, lover, and son, featuring spoken inner monologues.
filmography.plot: Based on Eugene O'Neill's play, a woman marries a man she doesn't love to hide her affair with another.

filmography.title: Smilin' Through
filmography.role_description: A dual role as a woman murdered on her wedding day and her niece who falls in love with the murderer's son.
filmography.plot: A woman falls in love with the son of the man who accidentally killed her guardian's fiancée years earlier.

filmography.title: Riptide
filmography.role_description: An American woman married to a British aristocrat who becomes involved in a scandal after a drunken escapade.
filmography.plot: A woman tries to make her husband jealous by flirting with an old flame, but things get out of hand.

filmography.title: The Barretts of Wimpole Street
filmography.role_description: The invalid poetess who finds the courage to defy her tyrannical father and elope with Robert Browning.
filmography.plot: The invalid poetess Elizabeth Barrett defies her domineering father to marry the dashing poet Robert Browning.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Oscar: Nomination – Best Picture

filmography.title: Romeo and Juliet
filmography.role_description: Shakespeare's tragic heroine who defies her family to be with her true love, in a lavish MGM production.
filmography.plot: The Montagues and Capulets feud in Verona while their children Romeo and Juliet fall in love.

filmography.title: Marie Antoinette
filmography.role_description: The ill-fated Queen of France, portrayed from her arrival as a teenage bride to her final days during the Revolution.
filmography.plot: The life of Marie Antoinette from her betrothal to Louis XVI to her execution during the French Revolution.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Venice Film Festival: Win – Volpi Cup

filmography.title: Idiot's Delight
filmography.role_description: A mysterious Russian countess with a questionable past who encounters a former lover in a hotel on the eve of war.
filmography.plot: A group of disparate travelers are stranded at a Swiss hotel as World War II begins.

filmography.title: The Women
filmography.role_description: A dignified socialite who navigates divorce and betrayal in a circle of gossiping friends, eventually fighting to win her husband back.
filmography.plot: A wealthy woman discovers her husband is having an affair with a shopgirl, leading to a divorce and a battle of wits among her social circle.

filmography.title: Escape
filmography.role_description: An American-born countess in pre-WWII Germany who helps an American man rescue his mother from a concentration camp.
filmography.plot: An American tries to get his mother out of a concentration camp in Nazi Germany with the help of a countess.

filmography.title: We Were Dancing
filmography.role_description: A Polish princess who falls in love with a professional houseguest, leading to a screwball romance.
filmography.plot: A princess runs away from her engagement party with a charming gigolo, but their romance hits a snag.

filmography.title: Her Cardboard Lover
filmography.role_description: A songwriter who hires a man to pretend to be her lover to make her real boyfriend jealous; Shearer's final film role.
filmography.plot: A woman hires a man to pose as her lover to discourage a suitor she can't resist.
